# Introduction

This is an investigation into the CO~2~ emissions that agriculture produces in various regions of the world. The investigation focuses on the CO~2~ emissions from pesticides, packaging, retail, transportation, industrial processes and product use. The question this investigation is trying to answer is: Do the added on 'ingredients', such as pesticides, industrial processes, packaging and food retail including transportation, contribute significantly to CO~2~ emissions?

This question is important to answer because there is a strong interest in the

-   does the production of co2 pesticides contribute overall to the contribution of co2 in the environment

    these questions are important to me because i have always been interested in our food processes and consumption habits. How is it many people are actively and unknowingly throwing away their food and it has become a comodity while other poeple are barely able to find a decent meal to live off of.

```{.r .cell-code}
foodAgro <- read.csv("Agrofood_co2_emission.csv")

foodArgo2 <- foodAgro |> 
  rename(years_recorded = Year, geograph_area = Area) |> 
  group_by(geograph_area) |> 
  summarise(years_recorded, 
      geograph_area,
      total_emission, 
      Pesticides.Manufacturing, 
      IPPU, Food.Transport, 
      Food.Retail, 
      Food.Processing, 
      Food.Packaging) |>
  mutate(food.ready.emissions = 
          Food.Transport 
        + Food.Retail
        + Food.Packaging 
        + Food.Processing)
```
